templates.name: VMware Hypervisor
templates.description: Generated by official Zabbix template tool "Templator"

items.name: Hypervisor ping
items.description: Checks if the hypervisor is running and accepting ICMP pings.

triggers.name: Hypervisor is down
triggers.description: The service is unavailable or does not accept ICMP ping.

items.name: Cluster name
items.description: Cluster name of the guest VM.

items.name: CPU usage in percents
items.description: CPU usage as a percentage during the interval.

items.name: CPU usage
items.description: Aggregated CPU usage across all cores on the host in Hz. This is only available if the host is connected.

items.name: CPU utilization
items.description: CPU usage as a percentage during the interval depends on power management or HT.

items.name: Datacenter name
items.description: Datacenter name of the hypervisor.

items.name: Full name
items.description: The complete product name, including the version information.

items.name: CPU frequency
items.description: The speed of the CPU cores. This is an average value if there are multiple speeds. The product of CPU frequency and number of cores is approximately equal to the sum of the MHz for all the individual cores on the host.

items.name: CPU model
items.description: The CPU model.

items.name: CPU cores
items.description: Number of physical CPU cores on the host. Physical CPU cores are the processors contained by a CPU package.

items.name: CPU threads
items.description: Number of physical CPU threads on the host.

items.name: Total memory
items.description: The physical memory size.

items.name: Model
items.description: The system model identification.

items.name: Bios UUID
items.description: The hardware BIOS identification.

items.name: Vendor
items.description: The hardware vendor identification.

items.name: Ballooned memory
items.description: The amount of guest physical memory that is currently reclaimed through the balloon driver. Sum of all guest VMs.

items.name: Used memory
items.description: Physical memory usage on the host.

items.name: Number of bytes received
items.description: VMware hypervisor network input statistics (bytes per second).

items.name: Number of bytes transmitted
items.description: VMware hypervisor network output statistics (bytes per second).

items.name: Power usage maximum allowed
items.description: Maximum allowed power usage.

items.name: Power usage
items.description: Current power usage.

items.name: Get sensors
items.description: Master item for sensors data.

items.name: Overall status
items.description: The overall alarm status of the host: gray - unknown, green - ok, red - it has a problem, yellow - it might have a problem.

triggers.name: The {$VMWARE.HV.UUID} health is Red
triggers.description: One or more components in the appliance might be in an unusable status and the appliance might become unresponsive soon. Security patches might be available.

triggers.name: The {$VMWARE.HV.UUID} health is Yellow
triggers.description: One or more components in the appliance might become overloaded soon.

items.name: Uptime
items.description: System uptime.

items.name: Version
items.description: Dot-separated version string.

items.name: Number of guest VMs
items.description: Number of guest virtual machines.

trigger_prototypes.name: The multipath count has been changed
trigger_prototypes.description: The number of available datastore paths less than registered ({#MULTIPATH.COUNT}).

item_prototypes.name: Average read latency of the datastore {#DATASTORE}
item_prototypes.description: Average amount of time for a read operation from the datastore (milliseconds).

item_prototypes.name: Free space on datastore {#DATASTORE} (percentage)
item_prototypes.description: VMware datastore space in percentage from total.

item_prototypes.name: Average write latency of the datastore {#DATASTORE}
item_prototypes.description: Average amount of time for a write operation to the datastore (milliseconds).

discovery_rules.name: Healthcheck discovery
discovery_rules.description: VMware Rollup Health State sensor discovery.

item_prototypes.name: Health state rollup
item_prototypes.description: The host health state rollup sensor value: gray - unknown, green - ok, red - it has a problem, yellow - it might have a problem.

trigger_prototypes.name: The {$VMWARE.HV.UUID} health is Red
trigger_prototypes.description: One or more components in the appliance might be in an unusable status and the appliance might become unresponsive soon. Security patches might be available.

trigger_prototypes.name: The {$VMWARE.HV.UUID} health is Yellow
trigger_prototypes.description: One or more components in the appliance might become overloaded soon.

discovery_rules.name: Sensor discovery
discovery_rules.description: VMware hardware sensor discovery. The data is retrieved from numeric sensor probes and provides information about the health of the physical system.

item_prototypes.name: Sensor [{#NAME}] health state
item_prototypes.description:
VMware hardware sensor health state. One of the following:
- Unknown
- Green
- Yellow
- Red

trigger_prototypes.name: Sensor [{#NAME}] health state is Red
trigger_prototypes.description: One or more components in the appliance might be in an unusable status and the appliance might become unresponsive soon.

trigger_prototypes.name: Sensor [{#NAME}] health state is Yellow
trigger_prototypes.description: One or more components in the appliance might become overloaded soon.

macros.description: Set "true"/"false" to enable or disable monitoring of hardware sensors.
Sets the regex string of hardware sensor names to allow in discovery.
Sets the regex string of hardware sensor names to ignore in discovery.
VMware service (vCenter or ESX hypervisor) SDK URL (https://servername/sdk).
